content.description:
This is a great day in the mountains! Many short pitches of ice, maybe 20. It is most Yukoner's first ice climb. Bring a short rope for a friend to follow, a 20-30m rope will do. Most pitches are under 4m, there are two longer pitches ~8m. If you're reading between the lines, many short pitches means bulges! You'll get lots of practice climbing through unpredictable bulges. So don't fall asleep as you're heading up.
It can shape up in October, so keep your eyes open and ask around if the ice is in. This climb needs some travel to thicken it up (open up any trapped water at the edges of the pools). If you're traveling up it for the first time, give yourself 2-3 hours to enjoy the beauty of the area. Once it settles out at the top, exit climber's right. You can hike down next to the ice canyon.

As per the description to Lover's Quarrel. The pillar (Lover's Quarrel) is the beginning of this long climb. However, you can start above it by following a path climber's right of the crag. Once you've hiked above the crag, there are two entry points to the ice. It's much easier to start this climb from the second entry point to the ice, ~30m above the cliffs of the crag. The path and ice almost converge at this point, but you'll need to climb down (it can be quite slick) to a nice ice platform.
ice screws, quick draws and 30m rope

This ice pillar can be stout or skinny all depending on the autumn rain fall and traffic on the route above. As ice is fickle, it can be beautiful solid ice to wet chandelier. About 4-5 body lengths of 75-80 degree ice, then mellows out to a couple bulges till you meet the anchor on the right. As described in overview for the area.

To access the top rope, follow the trail climbers right till you get to an entry point to the ice. There are two obvious ones. The first entry point is protected by limestone slab, usually covered in snow. This one is directly above the pillar and can be very tricky (there are lots of trees to make an anchor from). It's advised to hike up a little further, access the ice and climb down two short (body length) ice pitches to access the bolted top anchor. ice screws, draws and 3 bolted anchor

climbs.name: Ribbed for Your Pleasure
climbs.fa: Charles Kalinsky and Derek Cronmiller Nov 2019

content.description:
Drytooling at its finest! Find the enhanced pick points and dance up this undulating climb.
Easy rock climb to the first bolt. Climb through an initial short overhang, match and look for good feet. This leads to small ledges and a corner for a rest. Look up and right then head to the bolts to your left. Lots of options out right to a flake which leads to the anchors above.

Currently only bolted line
7 bolts and rap anchor
Have a great time winter cragging! There is dry, mixed and ice climbing. It is a cold trap, so bring your layers!
